question: हिमाचल प्रदेश को पूर्ण राज्य का दर्जा कब मिला?
explanation: हिमाचल प्रदेश 25 जनवरी 1971 को भारत का 18वाँ राज्य बना। इसे 1948 में मुख्यायुक्त प्रांत और 1956 में केंद्रशासित प्रदेश का दर्जा मिला था।

question: हिमाचल प्रदेश की राजधानी कौन सी है?
explanation: शिमला हिमाचल प्रदेश की ग्रीष्मकालीन राजधानी है। 2017 से धर्मशाला (कांगड़ा) को शीतकालीन राजधानी घोषित किया गया।

question: हिमाचल प्रदेश का राजकीय पक्षी कौन सा है?
explanation: पश्चिमी ट्रैगोपान (Western Tragopan/जुजुराना) हिमाचल प्रदेश का राजकीय पक्षी है। यह एक दुर्लभ हिमालयी पक्षी है।

question: हिमाचल प्रदेश में कुल कितने जिले हैं?
explanation: हिमाचल प्रदेश में कुल 12 जिले हैं: बिलासपुर, चंबा, हमीरपुर, कांगड़ा, किन्नौर, कुल्लू, लाहौल-स्पीति, मंडी, शिमला, सिरमौर, सोलन, ऊना।

question: हिमाचल प्रदेश का सबसे बड़ा जिला (क्षेत्रफल) कौन सा है?
explanation: लाहौल-स्पिती हिमाचल प्रदेश का सबसे बड़ा जिला (13,835 वर्ग किमी) है, लेकिन जनसंख्या में सबसे कम।

question: हिमाचल प्रदेश के प्रथम मुख्यमंत्री कौन थे?
explanation: डॉ. यशवंत सिंह परमार हिमाचल प्रदेश के प्रथम मुख्यमंत्री थे। उन्हें 'हिमाचल प्रदेश के निर्माता' कहा जाता है।

question: हिमाचल प्रदेश की सबसे ऊँची चोटी कौन सी है?
explanation: शिल्ला (Shilla Peak) 7,025 मीटर ऊँची है और किन्नौर जिले में स्थित है। यह HP की सबसे ऊँची चोटी है।

question: The Great Himalayan National Park (UNESCO World Heritage Site) is located in which district?
explanation: GHNP is in Kullu district, established in 1984 and declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2014. It covers 754.4 sq km.

question: हिमाचल प्रदेश का राजकीय फूल कौन सा है?
explanation: रोडोडेंड्रॉन (बुरांश/Rhododendron) हिमाचल प्रदेश का राजकीय फूल है। यह गुलाबी-लाल रंग का होता है।

question: हिमाचल प्रदेश में कितनी विधानसभा सीटें हैं?
explanation: हिमाचल प्रदेश विधानसभा में 68 सीटें हैं। राज्य में एकसदनीय विधायिका है (केवल विधानसभा)।

question: Rohtang Pass connects which two valleys?
explanation: Rohtang Pass (3,978 m) connects the Kullu Valley with the Lahaul Valley in Himachal Pradesh. The Atal Tunnel (2020) provides year-round connectivity below it.

question: अटल टनल (रोहतांग) की लंबाई कितनी है?
explanation: अटल टनल 9.02 किमी लंबी है, जो 10,000 फीट (3,000 मीटर) की ऊँचाई पर दुनिया की सबसे लंबी राजमार्ग सुरंग है। इसका उद्घाटन 3 अक्टूबर 2020 को हुआ।

question: हिमाचल प्रदेश की प्रमुख नदियाँ कौन सी हैं?
explanation: हिमाचल प्रदेश की 5 प्रमुख नदियाँ: सतलुज (सबसे लंबी), ब्यास, रावी, चिनाब और यमुना हैं। ये सभी हिमालय से निकलती हैं।

question: Bhakra Dam is built on which river?
explanation: Bhakra Dam is built on Sutlej river in Bilaspur district of HP. It is one of the highest gravity dams in the world (226 m). Gobind Sagar Lake is its reservoir.

question: हिमाचल प्रदेश का सबसे छोटा जिला (क्षेत्रफल) कौन सा है?
explanation: हमीरपुर हिमाचल प्रदेश का सबसे छोटा जिला (1,118 वर्ग किमी) है लेकिन जनसंख्या घनत्व में अधिक है।

question: Kangra Fort is one of the oldest forts in India, located in which district?
explanation: Kangra Fort (Nagarkot) is in Kangra district, one of the oldest and largest forts in the Himalayas, dating back to the Katoch dynasty.

question: हिमाचल प्रदेश का राजकीय पशु कौन सा है?
explanation: हिम तेंदुआ (Snow Leopard/Panthera uncia) हिमाचल प्रदेश का राजकीय पशु है। यह ऊँचे पहाड़ों में पाया जाता है।

question: The famous Dussehra festival in Kullu starts on:
explanation: Kullu Dussehra is unique because it starts on Vijayadashami when other celebrations end, and continues for 7 days. It is an international-level festival.

question: YSPUHF (Dr. YS Parmar University of Horticulture and Forestry) is located at:
explanation: YSPUHF is located at Nauni, Solan, established in 1985. It is dedicated to horticulture and forestry education and research in HP.

question: हिमाचल प्रदेश में सेब उत्पादन का प्रमुख जिला कौन सा है?
explanation: शिमला जिला हिमाचल प्रदेश में सेब उत्पादन का सबसे बड़ा जिला है, जो कुल उत्पादन का लगभग 60% है। इसके बाद कुल्लू और किन्नौर हैं।

question: The Kangra School of Painting belongs to which style?
explanation: Kangra School of Painting is a sub-school of Pahari painting, known for delicate brushwork, soft colors, and themes of Radha-Krishna love.

question: Pin Valley National Park is located in:
explanation: Pin Valley National Park is in Lahaul-Spiti district, established in 1987. It is a cold desert biosphere home to snow leopard, ibex, and bharal.

question: HPRCA (Himachal Pradesh Rajya Chayan Aayog) was formerly known as:
explanation: HPRCA was formerly HPSSC (Himachal Pradesh Staff Selection Commission). It conducts recruitment exams for various Group C and D posts including TGT, HEO etc.

question: हिमाचल प्रदेश का कुल क्षेत्रफल कितना है?
explanation: हिमाचल प्रदेश का कुल क्षेत्रफल 55,673 वर्ग किमी है, जो भारत के कुल क्षेत्रफल का लगभग 1.7% है।

question: Renuka Lake, the largest natural lake in HP, is located in:
explanation: Renuka Lake is in Sirmour district. It is the largest natural lake in HP and is shaped like a sleeping woman (Goddess Renuka). It has a small zoo nearby.

question: Shimla Agreement between India and Pakistan was signed in:
explanation: Shimla Agreement was signed on 2 July 1972 between Indira Gandhi and Zulfikar Ali Bhutto after the 1971 Indo-Pak war.

question: CSKHPKV (Chaudhary Sarwan Kumar HP Krishi Vishvavidyalaya) is located at:
explanation: CSKHPKV is located at Palampur, Kangra district. It is the state agricultural university established in 1978.

question: Which pass connects Kullu and Spiti valleys?
explanation: Kunzum Pass (4,590 m) connects Kullu (via Lahaul) to Spiti Valley. It opens only during summer months (June-October).

question: Gobind Sagar Lake is formed by which dam?
explanation: Gobind Sagar Lake is the reservoir formed behind Bhakra Dam on Sutlej river in Bilaspur district. It is the largest man-made reservoir in HP.

question: हिमाचल प्रदेश का राजकीय वृक्ष कौन सा है?
explanation: देवदार (Cedrus deodara) हिमाचल प्रदेश का राजकीय वृक्ष है। यह हिमालयी क्षेत्र का प्रमुख शंकुधारी वृक्ष है।

question: Spiti Valley is known as:
explanation: Spiti (Tibetan: 'The Middle Land') is a cold desert valley between Tibet and India, part of Lahaul-Spiti district.

question: Which HP district has the highest literacy rate?
explanation: Hamirpur has the highest literacy rate (~89%) in Himachal Pradesh. HP as a whole has ~83% literacy, among the highest in India.

question: Pong Dam (Maharana Pratap Sagar) is built on which river?
explanation: Pong Dam is built on Beas river in Kangra district. The reservoir (Maharana Pratap Sagar) is a Ramsar wetland site.

question: Chamba Rumal is famous for:
explanation: Chamba Rumal is a traditional hand-embroidered textile art from Chamba district, known for double-sided embroidery depicting mythological scenes.

question: हिमाचल प्रदेश में लोकसभा की कितनी सीटें हैं?
explanation: हिमाचल प्रदेश में लोकसभा की 4 सीटें हैं: शिमला, मंडी, कांगड़ा और हमीरपुर।

question: The Shimla-Kalka Railway is a UNESCO World Heritage Site built in:
explanation: Shimla-Kalka Railway (96.6 km, 102 tunnels, 806 bridges) was completed in 1903 and declared UNESCO Heritage in 2008.

question: Which district of HP is known as the 'Mushroom City of India'?
explanation: Solan is called the 'Mushroom City of India' due to its large-scale commercial mushroom production and the presence of DMR (Directorate of Mushroom Research).

question: Kinnauri apple is a GI-tagged product from which area?
explanation: Kinnauri apple from Kinnaur district received GI (Geographical Indication) tag for its distinctive quality grown at high altitudes (2,500-3,500m).

question: Which festival in HP celebrates the sowing of wheat?
explanation: Halda is a traditional harvest festival celebrating wheat sowing, observed mainly in the Shimla hills region of HP.

question: Indian Institute of Advanced Study (IIAS) is housed in:
explanation: IIAS is housed in the Viceregal Lodge (Rashtrapati Niwas) atop Observatory Hill in Shimla, built in 1888 in British Jacobethan style.

question: हिमाचल प्रदेश की सबसे लंबी नदी कौन सी है?
explanation: सतलुज हिमाचल प्रदेश की सबसे लंबी नदी है (320 किमी HP में)। यह मानसरोवर (तिब्बत) से निकलती है।

question: Key Monastery (Ki Gompa) is located in:
explanation: Key Monastery is the largest and oldest monastery in Spiti Valley (Lahaul-Spiti), at 4,166 meters altitude, belonging to the Gelugpa sect.

question: HP's economy is primarily based on:
explanation: HP's economy is predominantly agriculture and horticulture based, with apple being the most important cash crop, followed by hydropower and tourism.

question: Bhuri Singh Museum is located in:
explanation: Bhuri Singh Museum is in Chamba, established in 1908 by Raja Bhuri Singh. It houses Pahari miniature paintings, Chamba Rumals, and artifacts.

question: HPMC (Himachal Pradesh Horticultural Produce Marketing and Processing Corporation) headquarters is at:
explanation: HPMC is headquartered in Shimla. It processes and markets horticultural produce like apple juice, concentrates and jams from HP.

question: HP Budget 2025-26 total outlay presented by CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu is:
explanation: CM Sukhu presented a tax-free HP Budget 2025-26 with total outlay of ₹58,514 crore on 17 March 2025.

question: HP's projected GSDP for 2025-26 is approximately:
explanation: HP's projected GSDP for 2025-26 is ₹2,55,636 crore, a 10% growth over 2024-25.

question: HP Shiva Project (Subtropical Horticulture, Irrigation and Value Addition Project) outlay is:
explanation: HP SHIVA Project with ₹1,292 crore outlay aims to enhance horticulture across seven districts.

question: HP SHIVA Project covers how many districts?
explanation: HP SHIVA Project covers seven districts for subtropical horticulture, irrigation and value addition.

question: Him Bhog Atta Initiative in HP sources maize flour from:
explanation: Him Bhog Atta Initiative supports natural farming by sourcing maize flour from organically grown maize.

question: The World Bank approved how much funding for HP in 2026 for disaster management?
explanation: On 10 Feb 2026, World Bank approved $245 million for HP to manage extreme weather events and rebuild resilient infrastructure.

question: Rajiv Gandhi Prakritik Kheti Start-up Yojana in HP promotes:
explanation: This scheme promotes natural farming practices in Himachal Pradesh.

question: HP Organic Compost Scheme purchases organic/vermicompost at:
explanation: HP Organic Compost Scheme purchases organic and vermicompost at ₹300 per quintal to aid small farmers.

question: HP Budget 2025-26 plans to bring how many additional farmers under natural farming?
explanation: HP Budget 2025-26 plans to bring an additional 1 lakh farmers under natural farming practices.

question: Spice Park announced in HP Budget 2025-26 will be established in:
explanation: A Spice Park in Hamirpur was announced in HP Budget 2025-26 for spice processing and value addition.

question: The Chief Minister Tourism Start-Up Scheme in HP has an outlay of:
explanation: CM Tourism Start-Up Scheme offers interest subvention of 4-5% on loans for homestays/hotels with ₹50 crore outlay.

question: Indira Gandhi Sukh Suraksha Yojana deposits how much when a girl child is born in BPL family?
explanation: ₹25,000 is deposited in an insurance company when a girl child is born in a BPL family under this scheme.

question: HP Sahara Yojana provides monthly assistance of how much to patients with serious diseases?
explanation: HP Sahara Yojana provides ₹3,000/month to economically weaker patients suffering from cancer, Parkinson's, paralysis etc.

question: Under Him Unnati Yojana, the focus is on:
explanation: Him Unnati Yojana (also called Him Krishi Yojana) is for overall development of agriculture in HP.

question: In HP Budget 2025-26, cow milk price was increased from ₹45 to:
explanation: Cow milk price increased from ₹45 to ₹51/litre and buffalo milk from ₹55 to ₹61/litre in HP Budget 2025-26.

question: HP Budget 2025-26 planned procurement of how many new electric buses?
explanation: HP Budget 2025-26 plans procurement of 500 new electric buses.

question: Who is the current CM of Himachal Pradesh (2025-26)?
explanation: Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu has been CM of HP since 11 December 2022.

question: The HP Special Relief Package for Disaster-Hit Families provides housing aid up to:
explanation: HP Special Relief Package (approved July 28, 2025) provides financial support ranging from ₹50,000 to ₹7 lakh for damaged houses.

question: HP Agriculture Loan Interest Subvention Scheme covers loans up to:
explanation: State bears 50% of accrued interest for agricultural loans up to ₹3 lakh under this one-time settlement scheme.

question: HP Dev Bhoomi Darshan Yojana provides how much bus fare discount for citizens aged 70-80?
explanation: 50% discount for 70-80 years and 100% discount for above 80 years on bus fares to holy places.

question: Who is the current Governor of Himachal Pradesh (2025-26)?
explanation: Shiv Pratap Shukla serves as the Governor of HP in 2025-26 and conferred Teachers' Day Awards in 2025.

question: Krishak Bakri Palan Yojana in HP aims at:
options: Goat rearing for income generation and meat production
explanation: Krishak Bakri Palan Yojana boosts income for economically weaker segments through goat rearing and meat production.

question: Kullu Dussehra 2025 was celebrated from:
explanation: Kullu Dussehra 2025 was celebrated from October 1-7, 2025.

question: HP Mukhyamantri Awas Yojana (HPBOCWWB) provides housing aid of:
explanation: ₹1,50,000 financial assistance for housing is provided to registered building and construction workers.

question: HP fiscal deficit target for 2025-26 is what percentage of GSDP?
explanation: HP targeted fiscal deficit of 4% of GSDP, amounting to ₹10,338 crore for 2025-26.

question: Indira Gandhi Pyari Behna Sukh-Samman Nidhi Yojana provides:
explanation: This HP scheme provides monthly financial assistance to women in the state.

question: HP Electric Taxi Subsidy Programme under Rajiv Gandhi Self-Employment Start-up Scheme provides:
explanation: 50% subsidy is provided for purchasing e-taxis under this programme (from FY 2023).

question: Swami Vivekananda Utkrisht Chhatravriti Yojna in HP provides scholarship of:
explanation: ₹18,000/year scholarship for general category students after matriculation in HP.

question: Himachal Pradesh Assembly in Feb 2026 extended the term of mayor/deputy mayor to:
explanation: HP Municipal Corporation Amendment Bill 2025 extends the term of office for mayor and deputy mayor to five years.

question: Mandi Shivratri 2026 is planned for:
explanation: Mandi Shivratri 2026 is planned for February 15-21, 2026.
